lines.text: The people, Eddie, the people! Don't tell me about the people, Eddie. The people sit in front of their little TVs with their bellies full of beer and fall asleep. What do the people know, Eddie? Don't tell me about the people, Eddie!
I didn't come here to work out!
Don't fight it, Eddie! What are you trying to do, hold onto your self-respect? Did your self-respect help you hold your job? Did your self-respect give you a new column?
What gives, Eddie? I looked up Toro in the book. There's no record of him in South America.
He knocked out thirty-eight guys in a row. None of them went over three rounds. You believe that one and I'll tell you another.
Can he box?
No Gene Tunney.
Can he punch?
Not like Jack Dempsey.
Well, what's he got besides just being big?
He's got an iron jaw and a cast-iron stomach. Not a man alive can hurt him.
Powderpuff punch and a glass jaw... that's a great combination!
[last lines]
A man that gives away twenty-six thousand dollars you can't talk to. I wanna tell ya one more thing. I wouldn't give twenty-six cents for your future.
The fight game today is like show business. There's no real fighters anymore, they're all actors. The best showman becomes the champ!
[Willis tells Toro to throw his fight with Buddy Brannen to avoid getting hurt]
I don't know, I don't know. What would people think of me?

What do you care what a bunch of bloodthirsty, screaming people think of you? Did you ever get a look at their faces? They pay a few lousy bucks hoping to see a man get killed. To hell with them! Think of yourself. Get your money and get out of this rotten business.
Money's not evil in and of itself. The purpose for which it's used is the determining factor.
I know they are thieves. But you are a smart man, Eddie. They cannot fool you. How much money did you get for me? How much money, Eddie?
A man past his forties shouldn't have to run anymore.
